cost_objection.objection: Private instruction is too expensive / We can't afford ongoing lessons
cost_objection.underlying_concern: Is this really worth it compared to just paying team fees? What if we pay and don't see results?
cost_objection.authentic_response: I understand the investment feels significant. Let me put it in perspective: you're already investing [TEAM FEES] for your athlete to be part of the team. But if they're not getting individual attention on the specific skills holding them back, that investment isn't reaching its potential. Most families find that even one session every two weeks—focused on their specific needs—creates more improvement than months of general team practice. Plus, the skills and confidence they build stay with them forever, long after this season ends. What if we started with [TRIAL OFFER] so you can see the difference before committing to a full package?
cost_objection.reframe: The real cost is another season of frustration, lost confidence, and missed opportunities. Private instruction isn't an expense—it's unlocking the investment you've already made in equipment, team fees, and your athlete's time.

time_objection.objection: We're already so busy with team practices and games / Don't have time for more training
time_objection.underlying_concern: Will this overwhelm our schedule? Is adding more actually better or just more?
time_objection.authentic_response: You're right that time is precious, and I never want to add stress to your family's schedule. Here's what's different: focused, individual instruction is incredibly efficient. What might take months to develop through trial-and-error in team practice, we can often accelerate in a few targeted sessions. Many families actually find their athlete's overall practice time becomes MORE productive because they know exactly what to work on. We work around your schedule, and even bi-weekly or monthly sessions create significant improvement when combined with the practice plan I provide. Quality beats quantity every time.
time_objection.reframe: You're spending [HOURS] per week at practice and games already. Shouldn't at least some of that time be focused specifically on what YOUR athlete needs to improve?

diy_objection.objection: We can just watch YouTube videos / learn from free online resources
diy_objection.underlying_concern: Why pay for something when there's free information available? Can't we figure this out ourselves?
diy_objection.authentic_response: I love that you're proactive about improvement! And you're right—there's amazing free content out there. Here's what I've seen though: generic tips don't account for your athlete's specific mechanics, learning style, or the exact issue causing their struggles. I've worked with dozens of athletes who practiced hard using YouTube drills but were actually reinforcing bad habits because no one was there to give real-time feedback and corrections. The difference between knowing what to do and actually doing it correctly is huge. Think of it like learning an instrument—you can watch videos, but a teacher spots and fixes the small things that make all the difference. That's what you get here: personalized diagnosis and correction that's specific to [ATHLETE NAME]'s needs.
diy_objection.reframe: Free information is everywhere, but personalized feedback that actually changes performance? That's what creates breakthroughs.

timing_objection.objection: Maybe we'll wait until next season / off-season to start
timing_objection.underlying_concern: Is now really the right time or should we wait for a 'better' moment?
timing_objection.authentic_response: I understand wanting to wait for the 'perfect' time. But here's what I've learned from coaching [NUMBER] athletes: the best time to start is when you recognize there's a gap between where you are and where you want to be. If you wait until off-season, that's another [MONTHS] of your athlete practicing with flawed technique, potentially sitting the bench, and losing confidence. The athletes who make the biggest jumps are the ones who start NOW and use the current season as real-time feedback for what we're working on in training. We can see immediately what's working in games and adjust. Plus, starting now means they enter next season already ahead, not trying to catch up.
timing_objection.reframe: Every week of this season is an opportunity to improve or an opportunity lost. Which would you rather look back on?

results_objection.objection: How do I know this will actually work? / What if we don't see improvement?
results_objection.underlying_concern: I've been disappointed before. What makes this different? What if my child just isn't talented enough?
results_objection.authentic_response: That's a fair question, and honestly, I respect the skepticism—it means you're being thoughtful about this decision. Here's what I can tell you: I've worked with athletes at every level, from complete beginners to [LEVEL], and I've seen consistent improvement when athletes show up and apply what we work on. What I can't guarantee is overnight transformation or that your athlete will become a professional. What I CAN guarantee is that we'll identify the specific technical or mental barriers holding them back, create a clear development plan, and give them the tools to improve. Most families see noticeable changes within [TIMEFRAME]. And if after [TRIAL PERIOD] you don't feel like we're making real progress, [GUARANTEE/REFUND POLICY]. My reputation is built on results, not promises.
results_objection.reframe: The question isn't whether improvement is possible—it's whether you have the right guidance to make it happen. That's what I provide.

team_coach_objection.objection: Won't this conflict with what their team coach is teaching?
team_coach_objection.underlying_concern: Will this confuse my athlete or create tension with their current coach?
team_coach_objection.authentic_response: Great question—I actually work WITH your team coach's system, not against it. My job isn't to contradict what they're learning at practice; it's to help them master those skills faster and execute them better. I focus on the individual technique and fundamentals that make everything else click. Many team coaches actually appreciate when players get individual instruction because it means they come to practice more skilled and coachable. If you'd like, I'm happy to communicate with your team coach about what we're working on to ensure we're aligned. Think of me as the supplement to their team coaching, not a replacement.
team_coach_objection.reframe: Team coaches develop the team. I develop the individual player within that team system.

session_packages.strategy: Price per session decreases with package size
session_packages.psychology: Commitment discount rewards loyalty, reduces decision fatigue

tier_naming.psychology: Athletes buy into identity, not commodity

anchor_pricing.strategy: Show highest-tier first, make mid-tier look reasonable
anchor_pricing.psychology: Anchoring effect makes preferred option seem like smart choice

value_stacking.strategy: List all included benefits separately to show total value
value_stacking.example: 4 sessions ($300) + Video analysis ($100) + Custom training plan ($75) = $475 value for $350

scarcity_tactics.strategy: Limited spots based on real capacity constraints
scarcity_tactics.example: Only 3 spots per age group to maintain quality
scarcity_tactics.psychology: Scarcity increases perceived value and speeds decisions
